summary: Make your VIM bright with colors, and avoid the eyestrain.
name: spring.vim
description:
The spring.vim is a color sheme file (only for GVIM), which make the VIM bright with colors. It just like the flowers are in blossom in Spring. Additionally, it is said that there is a kind of light green color (RGB code: #cce8cf) which can avoid the eyestrain, at least make your eyes more comfortable. So the spring.vim was born. 

There are some screenshots on the website: 

http://srcexpl.blogspot.com/
install_details:
1\ Copy the spring.vim to the colors directory of Vimfiles, such as ~/.vim/colors/

2\ Add one command in your _vimrc or .vimrc: color spring

3\ Enjoy vimming:-)

versions.release_notes:
1\ Modified the colors of StatusLine, StatusLineNC and VertSplit and made it to be an revivalistic column.
2\ Add the color of Cursorline.
Added GUI version judgment and modified the guifg and guibg of StatusLine, StatusLineNC and VertSplit.
Just modified some 'gui' options for more useful in the software development.
